New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 10 月 11 日星期五 14:12:23 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lists mortgage-free Onehunga rental home for sale https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-lists-mortgage-free-onehunga-rental-home-for-sale/IJYBVT7KENFEBFURTJHZVVFQ7I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/prime-minister-christopher-luxon-lists-mortgage-free-onehunga-rental-home-for-sale/IJYBVT7KENFEBFURTJHZVVFQ7I/ Two-bedroom home's value has risen more than $300,000 since Luxon bought it. Fri, 11 Oct 2024 07:37:28 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon is selling another one of his investment properties, this two bedroom home in the Auckland suburb of Onehunga. It has a capital valuation of $1.15 million, but the listing agent has told potential buyers to "please disregard the current CV".
Woman’s memory under scrutiny in Tauranga seasonal workers’ rape trial https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/womans-memory-in-the-firing-line-in-tauranga-seasonal-workers-rape-Trial/I5WLMCXP6FFLZJR5WBIVYTC5OE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/womans-memory-in-the-firing-line-in-tauranga-seasonal-workers-rape-Trial/I5WLMCXP6FFLZJR5WBIVYTC5OE/ Hannah BartlettAfter struggling to piece together night's events, woman says she knows she said 'no'. Fri, 11 Oct 2024 07:00:00 +0000 Willie Tokon Tankon (left) and Jonathan Lumu, who are seasonal workers from Vanuatu, deny raping a woman during a night off work at their accommodation near Tauranga. They say the sex was consensual.

Lawyer Sue Grey facing misconduct charge for allegedly breaching suppression order https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/lawyer-sue-grey-faceing-misconduct-charge-for-allegedly-breaching-suppression-order/4UKKC6EEDFHM7HVEHKXMW4CNGI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/lawyer-sue-grey-faceing-misconduct-charge-for-allegedly-breaching-suppression-order/4UKKC6EEDFHM7HVEHKXMW4CNGI/ Tracy NealIt is alleged lawyer revealed the name of a child who had suppression in two interviews. Fri, 11 Oct 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Lawyer Sue Grey (left) and anti-vaccination mandate protesters outside the Auckland High Court as a case was heard over the supply of blood to a 4-month-old baby in Starship hospital who required urgent surgery. Grey was representing the child's parents. Photo / Alex Burton
